items.content_html: Guide pages need to use DefaultAPISidebar not APIRef.
items.title: Use correct sidebar for Streams guides

items.content_html:
This PR removes documentation for three features related to the doppler factor that have not been supported in browsers for over two years:

  • AudioListener.dopplerFactor
  • AudioListener.speedOfSound
  • PannerNode.setVelocity

Related BCD PRs:

  • mdn/browser-compat-data#19578
  • mdn/browser-compat-data#19579
  • mdn/browser-compat-data#19580
items.title: Remove documentation for features related to doppler factor

items.content_html:
Description

Added a new page under HTMLElement Events to describe the load event.

Motivation

There is no existing documentation about the load event's presence on HTML elements. There is an existing page about the Window load event. However, its behavior is sufficiently different from the behavior of the event on HTMLElements (HTMLImageElement, HTMLScriptElement, etc.).

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Added HTMLElement `load` event API reference

items.content_html:
• This is unmaintainable (we don't have a signal when the spec status change and we don't know where we mention it)
  • It is useless for web devs (They don't care the status of the spec)
  • The W3C status of the spec is useless for implementers (they always look at the latest draft)
items.title: Remove mention of spec status

items.content_html:
Description

This PR corrects the calcucation expressions in the example for hypot().

Motivation

Since the example uses <dimension>s instead of unitless <number>s as inputs, the entire calculation process has to carry the units (or "dimensions" in physics terms) along like the physics do. The current calculation process may also incorrectly suggest that inputs have to be of the same units instead of only being of the same type.

This blocks the l10n of the page.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Correct expressions for the `hypot()` CSS function

Maybe we have to remove See also, it looks wired, it's obvious that someone who can get here must understand countqueuingstrategy api, and bytelengthqueuingstrategy and other countqueuingstrategy pages don't provide the similar See also.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CountQueuingStrategy/highWaterMark

Maybe we have to remove See also, it looks wired, it's obvious that someone who can get here must understand countqueuingstrategy api, and bytelengthqueuingstrategy and other countqueuingstrategy pages don't provide the similar See also. Otherwise we should be in other pages also add.

Motivation

Additional details

items.content_html:
See https://whatpr.org/html/8502/browsing-the-web.html#the-navigation-must-be-a-replace.

Description

Remove two no-longer-true conditions for when navigation.navigate() throws a "NotSupportedError" DOMException.

Motivation

Because the previous text is no longer correct.

Additional details

This changed in the spec in whatwg/html@0e2536f and in Chromium in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4175895 , which landed in Chromium 112.0.5573.0.

I imagine it might be interesting to add this detail to the browser support table. But, IIUC that is a complicated process involving some data files in a different repository, which I unfortunately don't have the bandwidth for right now. So I thought just correcting the docs to be up to date with modern Chromium would be good.

Related issues and pull requests

None
items.title: Update navigation.navigate()'s "NotSupportedError" conditions

items.content_html:
Description

The Popover API is going to be available in Chrome 114. I've had this confirmed by the relevant engineers, and it is also reflected by the platform status entry: https://chromestatus.com/feature/5463833265045504.

See my research document for further details of what has been added in this PR.

Notes for followup:

  • In the main landing page, I have made mention of the current state of animation for popovers. AFAIK, this work is still underway at the CSSWG/Chrome, so we'll need to update this information once a resolution is available.
  • I created an example to demonstrate using nested popovers, but I'm not happy with it, and think there must be a cleaner, easier way to do this. Advice much appreciated!

@keithamus already did a bunch of fabulous work towards getting this documented. I've updated a few of your pages mate, to tweak wording and add some examples, but what was there was already pretty good. Nice job.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Related PRs:

  • BCD: mdn/browser-compat-data#19428
  • Examples: mdn/dom-examples#215
items.title: Add new and update existing popover api docs

items.content_html:
A one word change from "similar" to "identical". It clarifies that the timeStamp argument passed to a requestAnimationFrame callback function is the same value that you would get if you called performance.now() at the same time as you called the callback. If you check performance.now() within a callback function the value is only a few milliseconds later.

I do this now because I needed a way to get a timeStamp arg value without running requestAnimationFrame, and performance.now() did the trick. I needed it because I am allowing user-pausing and resuming of an animation, and I need to reset the start time based on the elapsed duration of the user pause. It helped to be able do it outside of the rAF callback loop.

It was unclear from this doc that I could use performance.now() to do it, so I had to test it out. As a result I thought it would be a good idea to clarify in the doc, especially once I saw that it was a mere one word change.
items.title: similar is identical
